texts.definition: Incremental selection of game elements by players.
markups: <style="Definition">Incremental selection of game elements by players.</style>

Many games revolve around players being provided with game elements, most commonly cards or tiles, that they later use to perform gameplay actions. The gaining of these are called <style="CurrentLink">Drafting</style> when not all of them are provided at the same time but when they rather are provided one at a time, possibly with choices of which one to pick and possibly with other gameplay in-between.

<style="CurrentLink">Drafting</style> is also used in some countries for leagues in <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/American%20Football">American Football</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Basketball">Basketball</link></style>, and other <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Category:Sports">Sports</link></style>. The computer game <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Bloodbowl%20(computer%20game)">Bloodbowl</link></style> has a similar feature and <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Dominion">Dominion</link></style> and <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Thunderstone">Thunderstone</link></style> have a form of <style="CurrentLink">Drafting</style> where players create their future drawing stacks by buying new cards.

<style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Puerto%20Rico">Puerto Rico</link></style> and <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Citadels">Citadels</link></style> provides players with <style="CurrentLink">Drafting</style> choices of which role to take for the current round, openly in the former and secretly in the latter. Players of <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/7%20Wonders">7 Wonders</link></style> pass cards between each other every turn after having selecting which to play. In <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Small%20World">Small World</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Showmanager">Showmanager</link></style>, and <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Ticket%20to%20Ride">Ticket to Ride</link></style> players have a spread of new races, performers, and "railroad colors" to select.

<style="CurrentLink">Drafting</style> is also exists as official options when playing <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Magic:%20The%20Gathering">Magic: The Gathering</link></style> and <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Race%20for%20the%20Galaxy">Race for the Galaxy</link></style>.

<style="CurrentLink">Drafting</style> consists of the incremental selection of game elements so the pattern requires the presence of something that can be selected. This is typically <style="Link"><link="cards">Cards</link></style> or <style="Link"><link="tiles">Tiles</link></style>, but, as several <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Category:Sports">Sport</link></style> leagues have shown, this can also be the players themselves. An alternative is <style="Link"><link="role-selection">Role Selection</link></style> which is <style="CurrentLink">Drafting</style> of actions (although often represent through <style="Link"><link="cards">Cards</link></style>) which is found for example in <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Citadels">Citadels</link></style> and <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Puerto%20Rico">Puerto Rico</link></style>. Regardless, the two main choices designing <style="CurrentLink">Drafting</style> concern which options of game elements (or players) should be possible and what types of actions players can do between each draft action (how many times <style="CurrentLink">Drafting</style> should be done is typically given by other design choices). <style="Link"><link="turn-taking">Turn Taking</link></style> is nearly always used in combination with <style="CurrentLink">Drafting</style>, either so players can in turn draft or so that other actions or game events can occur between each draft.

Players may have no influence over <style="CurrentLink">Drafting</style> by simply having to take new game elements from <style="Link"><link="drawing-stacks">Drawing Stacks</link></style>. Ways of providing players with a <style="Link"><link="freedom-choice">Freedom of Choice</link></style> regarding which elements to choice range from supporting <style="Link"><link="deck-building">Deck Building</link></style> to simply including several different <style="Link"><link="drawing-stacks">Drawing Stacks</link></style> (this mainly supports players to be able to feel <style="Link"><link="luck">Luck</link></style>) and having <style="Link"><link="drafting-spreads">Drafting Spreads</link></style> in which one or several game elements may be displayed and possible to pick. <style="Link"><link="drafting-spreads">Drafting Spreads</link></style> may be combined with <style="Link"><link="drawing-stacks">Drawing Stacks</link></style> to support <style="CurrentLink">Drafting</style>; this is used in <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Ticket%20to%20Ride">Ticket to Ride</link></style> and <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Showmanager">Showmanager</link></style>. <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Dominant%20Species">Dominant Species</link></style> combines several <style="Link"><link="drawing-stacks">Drawing Stacks</link></style> with turning over one <style="Link"><link="cards">Card</link></style> on each to create a <style="Link"><link="drafting-spreads">Drafting Spread</link></style> that is only refilled after each <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Rounds">Round</link></style>. Another way of providing <style="Link"><link="freedom-choice">Freedom of Choice</link></style> in <style="CurrentLink">Drafting</style> is giving a player several choices and then handing them over to another player after choosing one. This can be done for just one set of game elements (e.g. <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Citadels">Citadels</link></style>) or with the same number of sets as players (e.g. <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/7%20Wonders">7 Wonders</link></style>) so every player does drafting at the same time. Yet another way of providing <style="CurrentLink">Drafting</style> is letting players purchase the new game elements as <style="Link"><link="investments">Investments</link></style> (this occurs in some <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Category:Sports">Sport</link></style> leagues and in the computer version of <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Bloodbowl%20(computer%20game)">Bloodbowl</link></style>).

<style="CurrentLink">Drafting</style> can occur as a separate phase in the beginning of game instances - something necessary for use in <style="Link"><link="collectible-card-games">Collectible Card Games</link></style> and games with <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Pre-Customized%20Decks">Pre-Customized Decks</link></style> as a way to divide <style="Link"><link="cards">Cards</link></style> to players - as part of providing players with their <style="Link"><link="hands">Hands</link></style> or <style="Link"><link="drawing-stacks">Drawing Stacks</link></style>. Examples of games with this structure include some versions of <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Magic:%20The%20Gathering">Magic: The Gathering</link></style> games. The alternative is to do <style="CurrentLink">Drafting</style> during gameplay and this can be done to let players incrementally build their decks (i.e. <style="Link"><link="drawing-stacks">Drawing Stacks</link></style>) or to let players choose from a set of actions or roles but then let those not chosen be the choices for the next player in a game with <style="Link"><link="turn-taking">Turn Taking</link></style>. <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Dominion">Dominion</link></style> and <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Thunderstone">Thunderstone</link></style> are examples of the former while <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/7%20Wonders">7 Wonders</link></style> and <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Citadels">Citadels</link></style> are examples of the latter.

Avoiding that players have a <style="Link"><link="freedom-choice">Freedom of Choice</link></style> during the <style="CurrentLink">Drafting</style> and also avoiding that they can do actions between the drafts a very trivial instance of the pattern. This is however present in many <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Category:Card%20Games">Card Games</link></style>, e.g. <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Contract%20Bridge">Contract Bridge</link></style> and <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Whist">Whist</link></style>, where it is used to create all players' <style="Link"><link="hands">Hands</link></style>.

<style="CurrentLink">Drafting</style> share commonality with <style="Link"><link="token-placement">Token Placement</link></style> when players compete with each other over places in the latter since this is a case of <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Competitions">Competition</link></style> concerning <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Limited%20Resources">Limited Resources</link></style>. They can in these cases be seen as each other's inverses - one consists of removing elements from a collection while the other consists of filled empty slots. For this reason, game designers considering <style="CurrentLink">Drafting</style> may be well-advised to also consider the effects of <style="Link"><link="token-placement">Token Placement</link></style>. <style="Link"><link="bidding">Bidding</link></style> is another alternative to <style="CurrentLink">Drafting</style> and may be considered as well.

<style="CurrentLink">Drafting</style> is <style="Link"><link="collaborative-actions">Collaborative Actions</link></style> often used to construct <style="Link"><link="hands">Hands</link></style> or <style="Link"><link="drawing-stacks">Drawing Stacks</link></style> in a fashion which provides a <style="Link"><link="freedom-choice">Freedom of Choice</link></style> to players. When players have this <style="Link"><link="freedom-choice">Freedom of Choice</link></style>, it affects how <style="Link"><link="randomness">Randomness</link></style> has created initial game states. When several players are involved in <style="CurrentLink">Drafting</style> of the same elements, this is a <style="Link"><link="resource-competition">Resource Competition</link></style> since it a form of <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Competitions">Competition</link></style> over <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Limited%20Resources">Limited Resources</link></style> but can provide <style="Link"><link="player-balance">Player Balance</link></style>. When these elements are in fact members of <style="Link"><link="teams">Teams</link></style> in games with <style="Link"><link="tvt">TvT</link></style> gameplay, <style="CurrentLink">Drafting</style> can help support <style="Link"><link="team-balance">Team Balance</link></style>.

Having <style="CurrentLink">Drafting</style> but without gameplay actions between the draft and without any <style="Link"><link="freedom-choice">Freedom of Choice</link></style> of what to draft gives <style="Link"><link="excise">Excise</link></style> to a game. This may however be necessary to set up initial game states. A small amount of <style="Link"><link="excise">Excise</link></style> is likely to be caused by any type of <style="CurrentLink">Drafting</style> where the game elements need to be passed between players (for example the sending of <style="Link"><link="cards">Cards</link></style> between players in <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/7%20Wonders">7 Wonders</link></style>).
